content: eventually with a little tug the sides have square windows © astrid schandy 2024 aschandy@yahoo no astrid s diagonals sample 2 the diagonal stitches the diagonal stitches are extra stitches that are obviously diagonal they do not count as a regular stitch and they are always only done in the front of your work this means that when working odd row you are facing the front of your work so the diagonals go in the front when you are working even numbered row you are facing the back of your work so the diagonals go in the back stitch description us terms for the table below describing diagonal stitches double_crochet in the back dcib standard interlocking double_crochet in the back of your work double_crochet in the front dcif standard interlocking double_crochet in the front of your work treble_crochet in the back treble yarn over twice in the back of your work treble_crochet in the front treble yarn over twice in the front of your work stitch only basic vertical stitches diagonals are not counted as stitch previous stitch bottom of the stitch you last worked in current stitch the stitch you are working on next stitch * the stitch after the one you are working on together make all the stitches until before the last yarn over and finish off all together with one yarn over * note if you place a treble on the next stitch make sure not to skip it when you move on in the pattern to the next stitch that one becomes your current one the chart is better visible in the chart section this is only to show how diagonals are presented in a chart in this case i made them red for distinction but usually they are black as the rest of the chart below you have a description of each stitch and how it is made they are written in sets of either stitch + diagonal make stitch in the current one plus diagonal in next diagonal + stitch make diagonal in previous stitch made plus stitch in current examples b1tf b1 + diagonal in the front tff1 diagonal in the front + f1 chart odd row front of blanket even row back of blanket b1tf tbf1 dcib on current and treble in front on treble in back on previous and dcif on next together current together tfb1 f1tb treble in front on previous and dcib on dcif on current and treble in back on current together next together f1tf tbb1 dcif on current and treble in front on treble in back on previous and dcib on next together
